alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 1:56PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: Recent abnormally cold temperatures have caused ice formation on area rivers and streams across the Anchorage and Mat-Su valleys. This ice formation is causing ice jams, and has led to localized overflow flooding in the vicinity of the jam. Warming weather into this weekend will continue to enhance ice movement on the waterways, with continued low land overflows expected. Currently, widespread ice jams are being reported on streams in Anchorage and across other waterways including Wasilla Creek. As temperatures warm above freezing into the weekend, water levels may rise further due to runoff from snow melt. As the weekend progresses, ice jam issues should begin to subside as the warmer temperatures erode and lingering ice cover, which will allow water levels to decrease.
